availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Shuck (Marion County, Kentucky, lawyer and slaveholder.)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Lucretia Finley Shuck. Father of Joseph Shuck, Octavia Shuck, Susan Shuck, Finley Shuck, Mary Shuck, Fannie Shuck, and Minerva Shuck. Attorney in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons, including Charlotte [Unknown], in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Lawyer in Marion County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons, including Charlotte [Unknown] and Hagar Shuck, in Marion County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 399B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, Lebanon, p. 738.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 2, p. 499A.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Marion County Wills, vol. 1-2, 1863-1949, p. 122.
"John Shuck (1807-1873)," Find A Grave, Memorial #113531517, accessed May 16, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/113531517/john-shuck.
